edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers_v1

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers_v1.Shape
      • edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers_v1.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Colorable, ProcessingUI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpandableBall

    public class Ball
extends Shape
implements Colorable, ProcessingUI
    Ball class stores data associated with a ball and functions that access or manipulate that data. The Ball class is based on a generic Shape and has agreed to implement the Colorable and ProcessingUI interfaces so that code using the Ball class can check if it's an instance of those interfaces and be sure that those methods are defined. TODO: Complete the code for the Colorable interface
    Author:
    acase@cs.nyu.edu, YOUR INFORMATION

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int g)
        Specified by:
        setColor in interface Colorable
        Parameters:
        g - is the value to set all three color components to (valid values are between 0-255). For example, if a user passes in the value 128, it will set the red, green, and blue components all to 128.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int r,
            int g,
            int b)
        Specified by:
        setColor in interface Colorable
        Parameters:
        r - is the red component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
        g - is the green component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
        b - is the blue component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
